New Records: Mohammad Rizwan scored the slowest fifty by a Pakistan batter in men's T20Is with a 52-ball fifty.
Haris Rauf picked his 100th T20I wicket in just his 69th T20I innings, the third-fastest in T20I history.
Rizwan completed 50 catches in T20I cricket.
Key Match Events: Pakistan won by 7 wickets with 15 balls remaining.
Aaron Johnson scored a 44-ball 52 for Canada.
Haris Rauf took two crucial wickets in the tenth over.
Mohammad Amir struck the first blow for Pakistan by dismissing Navneet Dhaliwal.
Shaheen Shah Afridi took a wicket in his first over.
Babar Azam and Mohammad Rizwan added 31 runs in four overs after the powerplay.
Fakhar Zaman was caught out for 4 runs.
Babar Azam was dismissed after scoring a boundary in overs 11-15.
Rizwan hit a six in the 16th over to secure the win for Pakistan.
Pre-Game Insights: Babar Azam emphasized the importance of winning the match to stay in the competition.
Canada captain Saad Bin Zafar mentioned the historical difficulty of chasing on this pitch.
Pakistan made a crucial change by including Saim Ayub and dropping Iftikhar Ahmed.
The match was played on a fresh surface, the fourth drop-in pitch at Nassau County.
Post-Match Reflections: Mohammad Rizwan expressed relief as Pakistan secured their first win in Group A.
Babar Azam reflected on the importance of focusing on each game in T20 cricket.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Canada managed to breach the 100-mark with Kaleem Sana carving Naseem Shah over deep backward point.
Pakistan's fast bowlers kept their lines tight, restricting Canada to 106/7.
Aaron Johnson was the standout performer for Canada, scoring 52 off 44 balls.
Pakistan's win did not lift their NRR above that of USA.
The match was played in New York as part of the ICC Men's T20 World Cup 2024.
